org.supercsv.io
Interface ICsvMapWriter

All Superinterfaces:
ICsvWriter
All Known Implementing Classes:
CsvMapWriter
public interface ICsvMapWriter
extends ICsvWriter

This is a supertype for writers writing maps

Author:
Kasper B. Graversen

Method Summary
 void write(Map<String,? extends Object> values, String... nameMapping)
          Write the map into a line of the csv file.

Methods inherited from interface org.supercsv.io.ICsvWriter
close, getLineNumber, setPreferences, writeHeader
 

Method Detail

write

void write(Map<String,? extends Object> values,
           String... nameMapping)
           throws IOException
Write the map into a line of the csv file. Note that the writer provided in the argument will be wrapped in a BufferedWriter before accessed.

Parameters:
values - denotes map of values must be saved
nameMapping - defines order of the map's elements that are to be written. You need only to include the names you want to write.
Throws:
IOException
Since:
1.0

write

void write(Map<String,? extends Object> source,
           String[] nameMapping,
           CellProcessor[] processor)
           throws IOException
Write a line from a map converting processing the values before writing

Parameters:
source - denotes map of values must be saved
nameMapping - defines order of the map's elements that are to be written. You need only to include the names you want to write.
processor - An array of processors to process the map's values before writing. null denotes no processing is to be taken place for that element. The size of the array must match the nameMapping array.
Throws:
IOException - in case of an I/O error
Exception - in case one of the cell processors fail processing
Since:
1.20
